intro: Phyllostegia kamokuensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
